# The Model

$dS/dT = -B(t)SI$

$dE/dT = B(t)SI - omegaE$

$dI/dT = omegaE - yI$

$dR/dT = (1-f)yI$

$dD/dT = fyI$

$Rt = BtS(t)/y$

$Ro = BoS/y$

```{r}
# time 57 dagen (4924800)
time <- seq(1,250,1)

# standaard parameters
st.para <- c(k = 0.19,
             f = 0.39,
             y = 1/7.41, # 0.71
             omega = 1/9.31, # 0.33
             t = 30,
             Bo = 1.22*10^-6)



# standaard standaard waarden
st.state <- c(S = 10^6,
              E = 0, # normaal 0
              I = 1,
              R = 0,
              D = 0)



ebola.model <- function(time, para, state){
    with(as.list(c(state, para)),{
        Bt <- Bo * 10^( -k * (time - t))
        
        dS <- -Bt * S * I 
        dE <- Bt * S * I - omega * E
        dI <- omega * E - y * I
        dR <- (1 - f) * y * I
        dD <- f * y * I
        
        
        
        return(list(c(dS, dE, dI, dR, dD)))
    })
}

st.out <- ode(y = st.state,
           times = time,
           parms = st.para,
           func = ebola.model
           )


colnames(st.out) <- c("time",
                      "Susceptible individuals (S)",
                      "Exposed people (E)", 
                      "Infected people (I)",
                      "Recovered people (R)",
                      "Dead people (D)")


plot(st.out[,1], st.out[,2],
     type = "l",
     main = "People suseptible to virus infection")
    
plot(st.out[,1], st.out[,3],
     type = "l",
     main = "People exposed to virus")
    
plot(st.out[,1], st.out[,4],
     type = "l",
     main = "Amount of people infectet with ebola virus")
    
plot(st.out[,1], st.out[,5],
     type = "l",
     main = "people who have recovered from virus infection")
    
plot(st.out[,1], st.out[,6],
     type = "l",
     main = "Amount of dead people",
     ylab = "Cumulative number of cases")

```
